Content.Title: How to Apply
Content.BodyCopy:
The BYU-Idaho PTA program is now accepting applications to start in Fall of 2014. The application deadline has been extended until end of buisness hours July 29th, 2014. 

Statement of Nondiscrimination:  BYU-Idaho considers nondiscrimination to be fundamental to its mission, goals, and objectives. The university is committed not to unlawfully discriminate in the administration of its educational policies and practices for all individuals who meet University and department academic requirements and agree to abide by the University's standards of conduct and behavior.

Step 01 (Check to see if you qualify to apply):

Students applying to the BYU-I PTA program must meet the following qualifications.  Check to see if you are eligible to apply:

  • You must demonstrate at least one semester with 12 credits or more.  Even if you have all the pre-requisites, you will NOT be a qualified candidate if you cannot demonstrate successful completion of at least 12 credits in one semester. 
  • Overall GPA must be 3.0 or higher.  You must demonstrate a minimum of a "C" in pre-requisite courses.
  • You must be able to graduate from the PTA program with 120 credits or less. So, consider this limit when applying. CLICK HERE to see a listing of all PTA pre-requisite courses and program courses.  This will help you figure out if you can graduate with the 120 credit limit.
  • Students who already have a college degree are not eligible to apply.

If you are eligible to apply, continue on to step 02...

Step 02 (Download and Begin your Application):

CLICK HERE to get a .pdf of the application packet.  After the BYU-Idaho PTA program has received "Candidate" status from the accrediting body, fully completed applications will be accepted.
